task.title: Creating an Item Class for Subscriptions
task.shortdesc: Item Classes group and set options for items at the class level. All items must have an Item Class. The system automatically creates Item Classes for Event ticket types, and schedule items and sponsors, if enabled on the Event record.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Item Classes tab in the eStore application and click the New button.
Enter the Name of the Item Class. Click Save.
step.info: Identify the Business Group via the lookup and enter the Description for the Item Class.

step.cmd: Check the Is Subscription and Enable Assignments checkboxes.

stepsection.p: Assignment Roles control access to important functions related viewing and modifying subscriptions in the Community Portal.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Assignment Roles related list and click the New Assignment Role button.
Enter the Assignment Role Name to identify the assignees of the subscription and, optionally, enter a Description.

choices.choice: Is Active- The Is Active checkbox must be enabled in order for the items related to the subscription based Item Class to display in the Community Portal.
Is Default- When an Assignment Role is not selected, the customer is auto-assigned a Default role that will allow the assignee to view their subscription in the Community Portal.
Is Primary- When a customer is assigned to a subscription with Is Primary checked, the customer can modify their subscription in the Community Portal.

Receives Email Notifications- Check the Receives Email Communications checkbox to allow the customer to receive emails related to renewal notices, subscription logs, subscription amendments, and any other Admin modifications to their subscription.

step.info: At a minimum, a subscription based Item Class must have at least one Assignment Role with the Is Default and Is Active checkboxes enabled. If the Assignment is not the same as the Contact on the Sales Order, users must navigate to the Sales Order record to identify the Contact purchasing the subscription. All Assignments can view the subscriptions that are assigned to them. In order to allow the customer full access to subscription management in the Community Portal, enable Receives Email Communications, Is Primary, and Is Active.

step.cmd: Select the Is Active checkbox on the Item Class record and click Save.
step.info: For a subscription based Item Class, an Assignment Role must be created for the Item Class if assignments are enabled in order for the Item Class record to be considered Active.

taskbody.result: The Subscription based Item Class is created and Assignment Roles are set.
